packages.name: MacOS Microsoft Outlook
packages.releaseNotes:
• Fixed an issue where the "Received for" infobar was not showing for delegates in meeting requests.
• Fixed an issue where the subject and body were stripped when sending S/MIME emails in GCCH tenants.
• Fixed an issue where the Chat toolbar button was incorrectly shown when the Microsoft Teams app was not installed.
• Fixed an issue where “Reply All” was not functional when using keyboard shortcuts.
• Fixed an issue where S/MIME messages with large bodies were losing their content.

packages.name: MacOS Microsoft OneNote
packages.releaseNotes:
This month’s update is bug fixes only.

Thanks for using OneNote! We listened to your feedback and updated the application with optimizations to help improve your note taking experience. 
 
Having trouble? Send feedback in the app by clicking on the smiley face in the top-right of the app.
Have an idea? Add to our feature suggestion box at https://aka.ms/onenotefeedback

packages.name: MacOS Microsoft OneDrive
packages.releaseNotes: Thank you for using OneDrive. We are always looking to update OneDrive to bring you the latest performance improvements and bug fixes for the best experience.

packages.name: MacOS Microsoft Windows App
packages.releaseNotes:
In this release we made the following updates:

• Added support to prevent the title and menu bars from appearing in full screen mode.
• Integrated support for trackpad pinch and zoom gestures.
• Improved the Add menu by integrating help text (macOS 15 and later).
• Improved the resize behavior for the Connection Center tile view by leveraging scaling.
• Disabled applicable toolbar commands for empty Favorites, Devices and Apps tabs.
• Added the app version to log file names.
• Fixed some scenarios where the app would hang.
• Hovering over an in-app notification will now prevent it from disappearing.
• Made improvements to the code behind AVD feed discovery.
• Resolved accessibility bugs.

This is the last Windows App version that will support macOS 12. Future updates to Windows App will require macOS 13. If you are using macOS 12, the app will continue to work, but you won't receive new updates.

If you encounter any errors, you can contact us via Help > Submit Feedback.

packages.name: MacOS Microsoft To-Do
packages.releaseNotes: We fixed some bugs to improve the app experience.

packages.name: MacOS Microsoft Azure VPN Client
packages.releaseNotes:
Added auto reconnect on VPN connections for intermittent/ server failures. 
Added notification which notifies user to install rosetta in case its not installed in arm machines. 
Minor bug fixes and performance improvements.
